questions.question: The company has adopted, in short order, an aggressive, wide-ranging and/or large scale downsizing (stores, layoffs etc.) and cost-saving efforts
questions.factor: Material Strategic Action: Disinvestment, downsizing and/or cost-saving (closing of stores and/or downsizing labor force)

questions.question: The company has reported accelerating and/or plunging sales deterioration year over year (-4% to -20% or possibly greater)
questions.factor: Deterioration of Financial Performance: Topline (Sales)

questions.question: The company post profit losses in which yoy trends identify that the plunge is accelerating (-4% to -20% or possibly greater)
questions.factor: Deterioration of Financial Performance: Bottom Line (Profits)

questions.question: The company has a concerningly low current ratio and quick ratio
questions.factor: Deterioration of Financial Performance: Severe Liquidity problems

questions.question: The company has adopted a radical restructure and/or turnaround strategy
questions.factor: Material Strategic Action: Restructure, Rebrand, Turnaround and/or Redirection

questions.question: The company has changed key leadership positions (i.e. CEO) as a results of poor performance
questions.factor: Change in Executive Leadership

questions.question: The company's stock has collapsed or persistently drifted to extremely low levels threatening it compliance the exchange listing standard
questions.factor: Steep Decline in Stock Price and/or Exchange Delisting

questions.question: The company has experience a wide-spread loss in confidence and/or legitimacy by key investors and creditors
questions.factor: Loss of confidence and/or legitimacy by investors, partners, suppliers creditors and/or customers

questions.question: The company features structurally constrained operations which make it unable to adjusted to threatening forcing (e.g. price compete) and/or take advantage of favorable opportunities (less ability to innovate, improve operations etc.)
questions.factor: Structural Paralysis preventing strategic action or change in response to internal and external environment pressures

questions.question: Several vendors and/or suppliers demand tighter payment terms, reduce ship quantities, and/or refuse to provide products or services to the company
questions.factor: Suppliers want to be paid in shortly payment intervals and/or upfront

questions.question: The company has a concerningly high Debt to assets ratio and Debt to equity ratio
questions.factor: Significant Debt Levels and/or Accelerated Accumulation of Debt

questions.question: The company conducted a material acquisition and/or spun off underperforming subsidiaries
questions.factor: Material Strategic Action: M&A&D

questions.question: The company has adopted a strategy to diversify its product and services away from the core
questions.factor: Material Strategic Action: Diversification of Product and/or Service

questions.question: The company was acquired into PE firm or new Parent Organization, or was spun off by a PE firm or Parent Organization
questions.factor: Material Strategic Action: Sale or Divesture of Organization

questions.question: Performance of core products and services have slowed and/or lost market share
questions.factor: Declining/Lagging Product and/or Service Performance

questions.question: The Company adopted a turnaround or restructure attempt which ultimately made the company financially worse and/or failed to address critical issues
questions.factor: Failed Strategic Restructure, Turnaround and/or Redirection

questions.question: The company faces threatening and market share eroding competition from multiple sources and types of competition (peer incumbents, disruptive new entrants, and/or big-box businesses)
questions.factor: Increasing and/or Aggressive Competitive Rivalry

questions.question: Management made strategic decisions that were outright wrong and/or materially unfavorable to the business (post strategy execution result)
questions.factor: Inferior management quality and skill: Strategic Errors

questions.question: The company has experienced significant short-term growth and/or adopted a rapid expansion strategy, either domestically or internationally, that aims to significantly grow their footprint and potentially propelled them to a dominant and highly successful company in their industry (i.e. - widespread store expansion, aggressive acquisition strategy, etc.)
questions.factor: Management Strategic Focus: Aggressive, Ambitious and/or Risky Endeavors

questions.question: Management has shown inferior capabilities to address, gauge, understand and/or failure to anticipate material business-related matters
questions.factor: Inferior management quality and skill: Strategic Foresight

questions.question: Management respond to a changing industry landscape and/or competitive environment using proven strategies and tactics that allowed them to achieve success in past
questions.factor: Management Cognitive Inertia: Responding to change in environment

questions.question: Customers have shown a change in preference or demand for core products and services of the organization
questions.factor: Changes in consumer tastes, demand or market power

questions.question: The company lacks quality resources and core competencies to effective compete, manage a changing environment and/or fundamentally maintain the operations
questions.factor: Business Model: lack/loss/misallocation of quality resources and distinctive competencies

questions.question: The company appears to underestimate the need for marketing and/or a poor undifferentiated marketing strategy
questions.factor: Ineffective processes and systems: Marketing, Marketing Mix and/or Branding

questions.question: The company is financially vulnerable to a recessionary downturn
questions.factor: Changes in Economic Factors: Recessionary Downturn

questions.question: The company appears overwhelmed by a high debt burden loading on the company during a past buyout
questions.factor: Business Model: Constrained by Leveraged Buyout Debt

questions.question: Management has shown naivety (nonchalant action) and/or complacency (slow action) in effectively responding to a changing industry landscape and/or competitive environment
questions.factor: Management Cognitive Inertia: Responding to change in environment (Complacency)

questions.question: The company's industry is facing wide-ranging disruption, turmoil and/or change (Consolidation, change in investor confidence, etc.)
questions.factor: Industry-wide Disruption and Complexities

questions.question: There is material disharmony inside of the organization amongst employees and/or lower management
questions.factor: Ineffective management systems: Internal Stakeholder Disharmony

questions.question: The company has experience frequent turnover within the top-level executive team
questions.factor: Ineffective management systems: Frequently Changing Management Team

questions.question: The company is largely dependent on deteriorating low margin (low value) products or services
questions.factor: Business Model: Low Value/Devaluing Business activities (Products/Service)

questions.question: The company appears overwhelmed by a high debt burden loaded on the company during past buyout
questions.factor: Structural Inertia: Rigidity in Strategic Action

questions.question: Management appear resistant to change in light of an changing industry landscape and/or competitive environment
questions.factor: Management Cognitive Inertia: Resistance to change

questions.question: Top level management appear very confident, somewhat arrogant, and ignorant as a result of the companies past success
questions.factor: Management Personality deficiencies: hubris leader (narcissist, arrogance, excessive pride, dangerous overconfidence)

questions.question: Top level management have conflicting self-interests which could materially influence their strategic decisions and behaviors
questions.factor: Management Personality deficiencies: Conflicting Self-Interests
